maml:description.maml:para: Compare two keytab files with optional timestamp-insensitive and key-byte comparisons.

Reads both keytabs, canonicalizes their entries (optionally ignoring timestamps), and compares structure and, by default, key bytes. Returns an object with an Equal flag and a Differences collection describing any mismatches. Use -IgnoreKeyBytes for structure-only comparisons. Use -RevealKeys to include sensitive key bytes in the diff details (disabled by default for safety).
Path to the baseline (reference) keytab.
Path to the candidate keytab to compare against the reference.
Ignore per-entry timestamps when comparing (useful for reproducible checks).
Only compare structure (principal, name type, encryption type, KVNO). Do not compare key bytes.
Include raw key bytes in difference output. Sensitive-avoid in shared logs.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Path to the baseline (reference) keytab.
Path to the candidate keytab to compare against the reference.
Ignore per-entry timestamps when comparing (useful for reproducible checks).
Only compare structure (principal, name type, encryption type, KVNO). Do not compare key bytes.
Include raw key bytes in difference output. Sensitive-avoid in shared logs.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: System.String (file paths) or objects with FilePathRef/FilePathCand properties.
PSCustomObject with properties Equal (bool) and Differences (collection).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Compare-Keytab -ReferencePath .\tests\output\user.keytab -CandidatePath .\tests\output\roundtrip.keytab -IgnoreTimestamp Compare two keytabs while ignoring timestamps.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Compare-Keytab -ReferencePath a.keytab -CandidatePath b.keytab -IgnoreKeyBytes Perform a structure-only comparison (no key-byte check).

maml:description.maml:para: Convert canonical JSON back into a keytab file (requires key bytes).

Reads canonical JSON as produced by ConvertTo-KeytabJson -RevealKeys and reconstructs a MIT v0x0502 keytab. Requires key bytes to be present in JSON. Can restrict ACL on output and support deterministic timestamps for reproducible builds.
Path to the canonical JSON file.
Output keytab path to write.
Overwrite OutputPath if it exists.
Use a fixed timestamp for written entries for deterministic output.
Apply a user-only ACL on the output file.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Path to the canonical JSON file.
Output keytab path to write.
Overwrite OutputPath if it exists.
Use a fixed timestamp for written entries for deterministic output.
Apply a user-only ACL on the output file.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: System.String (file path) or objects with FilePath/FullName properties.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: ConvertFrom-KeytabJson -JsonPath .\entry.json -OutputPath .\out.keytab -Force Reconstruct a keytab from JSON, overwriting the destination if present.

maml:description.maml:para: Convert a keytab file to canonical JSON (keys masked by default).

Parses a keytab and emits a canonical JSON representation for diffs and tooling. Keys are masked by default; pass -RevealKeys to include raw key bytes. Use -IgnoreTimestamp to omit timestamp variance from the model.
Path to the input keytab file.
Path to write the resulting JSON. If omitted, JSON is written to the pipeline.
Include raw key bytes in the JSON. Sensitive-avoid in source control.
Exclude timestamps from the canonical model.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Path to the input keytab file.
Path to write the resulting JSON. If omitted, JSON is written to the pipeline.
Include raw key bytes in the JSON. Sensitive-avoid in source control.
Exclude timestamps from the canonical model.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: System.String (file path) or objects with FilePath/FullName properties.
System.String (OutputPath) when -OutputPath is provided, otherwise JSON text.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: ConvertTo-KeytabJson -Path .\in.keytab -OutputPath .\in.json Write canonical JSON to a file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: ConvertTo-KeytabJson -Path .\in.keytab -RevealKeys | Out-File .\in.revealed.json Output JSON with key material to the pipeline and save to a file.

maml:description.maml:para: Merge multiple keytabs into a single file with de-duplication and safety checks.
Reads input keytabs, de-duplicates entries across KVNO and encryption types, and writes a consolidated keytab. Blocks merges containing krbtgt entries unless -AcknowledgeRisk is provided.
One or more paths to input keytabs to merge.
Destination path of the merged keytab.
Overwrite OutputPath if it exists.
Apply a user-only ACL on the merged output file.
Required to proceed when krbtgt entries are detected in inputs.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
One or more paths to input keytabs to merge.
Destination path of the merged keytab.
Overwrite OutputPath if it exists.
Apply a user-only ACL on the merged output file.
Required to proceed when krbtgt entries are detected in inputs.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: System.String[] (file paths) or objects with Input/Output properties.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Merge-Keytab -InputPaths a.keytab,b.keytab -OutputPath merged.keytab -Force Merge two keytabs into a single file, overwriting the destination if present.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a keytab for an AD user, computer, or krbtgt using replication-safe extraction.

Front-door cmdlet that discovers principal type, selects safe encryption types by default (AES), and writes a deterministic keytab when -FixedTimestampUtc is provided. Supports summary JSON and pass-thru. Use -AcknowledgeRisk for krbtgt extractions.
The account's sAMAccountName (user, computer$, or krbtgt) (Pos 1).
Optional .env file to load credentials from (Pos 10).
Domain NetBIOS or FQDN. When omitted, attempts discovery (Pos 2).
Encryption type IDs to include. Default: 18,17,23 (AES-256, AES-128, RC4 opt-in) (Pos 3).
Encryption type IDs to exclude. (Pos 4).
Path to write the keytab file (Pos 5).
{{ Fill SummaryPath Description }}
Domain Controller to target for replication (optional) (Pos 7).
Free-text justification string for auditing high-risk operations (Pos 8).
Alternate credentials to access AD/replication (Pos 9).
Principal type. Auto infers from name; User, Computer, or Krbtgt can be forced.
Apply a user-only ACL to outputs.
Overwrite existing OutputPath.
Return a small object summary in addition to writing files.
Write a JSON summary file.
Include previous KVNO keys when available.
Include older KVNO keys (krbtgt scenarios).
Required for krbtgt extraction.
Emit additional diagnostics during extraction.
Suppress risk warnings.
Use a fixed timestamp for deterministic output.
For computer accounts, include HOST/shortname SPN.
Additional SPNs (service/host) to include for computer accounts.
Includes the RC4 encryption type (23).
{{ Fill AESOnly Description }}
{{ Fill AllowDeadCiphers Description }}
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The account's sAMAccountName (user, computer$, or krbtgt) (Pos 1).
Principal type. Auto infers from name; User, Computer, or Krbtgt can be forced.
Domain NetBIOS or FQDN. When omitted, attempts discovery (Pos 2).
Encryption type IDs to include. Default: 18,17,23 (AES-256, AES-128, RC4 opt-in) (Pos 3).
Encryption type IDs to exclude. (Pos 4).
Path to write the keytab file (Pos 5).
{{ Fill SummaryPath Description }}
Domain Controller to target for replication (optional) (Pos 7).
Free-text justification string for auditing high-risk operations (Pos 8).
Alternate credentials to access AD/replication (Pos 9).
Optional .env file to load credentials from (Pos 10).
Apply a user-only ACL to outputs.
Overwrite existing OutputPath.
Return a small object summary in addition to writing files.
Write a JSON summary file.
Include previous KVNO keys when available.
Include older KVNO keys (krbtgt scenarios).
Required for krbtgt extraction.
Emit additional diagnostics during extraction.
Suppress risk warnings.
Use a fixed timestamp for deterministic output.
For computer accounts, include HOST/shortname SPN.
Additional SPNs (service/host) to include for computer accounts.
Includes the RC4 encryption type (23).
{{ Fill AESOnly Description }}
{{ Fill AllowDeadCiphers Description }}
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-Keytab -SamAccountName web01$ -Type Computer -OutputPath .\web01.keytab -IncludeShortHost -Summary Create a computer keytab including short HOST/ SPNs and write a summary JSON.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-Keytab -SamAccountName user1 -IncludeEtype 18,17 -ExcludeEtype 23 -OutputPath .\user1.keytab -FixedTimestampUtc (Get-Date '2020-01-01Z') Create a deterministic user keytab with AES types only.

maml:description.maml:para: Generate a keytab from a password using MIT/Heimdal/Windows salt policies (AES only).
Derives AES keys (etype 17/18) via PBKDF2-HMACSHA1 and writes a MIT v0x0502 keytab. Defaults to AES-only, safe salt policy and supports deterministic timestamps for tests.
Kerberos realm (usually the AD domain in uppercase) (Pos 1).
PBKDF2 iteration count (default 4096) (Pos 10).
Account name when deriving a user or computer principal (use Principal for service names) (Pos 2).
SecureString password to derive keys from. Alternatively use -Credential (Pos 3).
Salt policy for string-to-key: MIT, Heimdal, or Windows (Pos 4).
Encryption types to include. Defaults to AES-256 and AES-128 (18,17) (Pos 5).
Encryption types to exclude from selection (Pos 6).
Path to write the generated keytab (Pos 7).
{{ Fill SummaryPath Description }}
Key Version Number to stamp into entries (default 1) (Pos 9).
PSCredential; the password part is used if -Password not provided.
Apply a user-only ACL on outputs.
Overwrite OutputPath if it exists.
Emit a JSON summary file.
Return a summary object in addition to writing files.
Use a fixed timestamp for deterministic output.
Includes the RC4 encryption type (23).
{{ Fill AESOnly Description }}
{{ Fill AllowDeadCiphers Description }}
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

PBKDF2 iteration count (default 4096) (Pos 10).
Full principal (e.g., http/web01.contoso.com@CONTOSO.COM) for service principals (Pos 2).
Salt policy for string-to-key: MIT, Heimdal, or Windows (Pos 4).
Encryption types to include. Defaults to AES-256 and AES-128 (18,17) (Pos 5).
Encryption types to exclude from selection (Pos 6).

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are bound by name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-KeytabFromPassword -Realm CONTOSO.COM -SamAccountName user1 -Password (Read-Host -AsSecureString) -OutputPath .\user1.keytab Generate a user keytab from a password with default AES types.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-KeytabFromPassword -Realm CONTOSO.COM -Principal http/web01.contoso.com@CONTOSO.COM -Credential (Get-Credential) -IncludeEtype 18 -Kvno 3 -OutputPath .\http.keytab Generate a service keytab with AES-256 only and KVNO 3.

maml:description.maml:para: Protect a keytab file at rest using Windows DPAPI.

Uses DPAPI (CurrentUser or LocalMachine scope) to encrypt a keytab file. Optional additional entropy can be provided. Can restrict ACL on the output and delete the plaintext original after successful protection.
Path to the plaintext keytab file to protect (Pos 1).
Destination path for the protected file. Defaults to <Path>.dpapi (Pos 2).
DPAPI scope: CurrentUser (default) or LocalMachine.
Optional additional entropy string to bind to the protection.
{{ Fill EntropySecure Description }}
Overwrite OutputPath if it exists.
Remove the original plaintext file after successful protection.
Apply a user-only ACL to the output file.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Path to the plaintext keytab file to protect (Pos 1).
Destination path for the protected file. Defaults to <Path>.dpapi (Pos 2).
DPAPI scope: CurrentUser (default) or LocalMachine.
Optional additional entropy string to bind to the protection.
{{ Fill EntropySecure Description }}
Overwrite OutputPath if it exists.
Remove the original plaintext file after successful protection.
Apply a user-only ACL to the output file.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: System.String (file path) or objects with FilePath/FullName properties.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Protect-Keytab -Path .\user.keytab -OutputPath .\user.keytab.dpapi -Scope CurrentUser -RestrictAcl Protect a keytab with DPAPI in the current-user scope and set a restrictive ACL.

maml:description.maml:para: Parse a keytab file into structured entries.
Robust parser for MIT keytab v0x0502. Can reveal raw key bytes for merge scenarios.
Path to the keytab file (Pos 1).
Include raw key bytes in each entry's RawKey property (sensitive).
Max length of the displayed hex string for masked key preview.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Path to the keytab file (Pos 1).
Include raw key bytes in each entry's RawKey property (sensitive).
Max length of the displayed hex string for masked key preview.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: System.String (file path) or objects with FilePath/FullName properties.
System.Object[]. Array of parsed entry objects.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Read-Keytab -Path .\user.keytab Parse a keytab and return entries.

maml:description.maml:para: Reset an AD account password and generate a corresponding keytab in one atomic operation.

Securely rotates an account's password to a strong random value, updates Active Directory, derives the corresponding Kerberos keys using the new password, and produces a keytab file. This ensures the keytab matches the account's actual password state without manual coordination. Only supports user accounts.
Uses BigBrother policy for etype selection with AES-only enforcement on the password derivation path. Requires explicit risk acknowledgment due to the high-impact nature of password changes.
The account's sAMAccountName to reset password for.
Kerberos realm name. If omitted, derives from the domain.
Specific password to set. If omitted, generates a cryptographically strong random password.
Key version number to use in the keytab. If omitted, predicts the post-reset KVNO.
Salt generation policy: MIT, Heimdal, or Windows (default).
Encryption types to include. Default: AES256, AES128.
Encryption types to exclude.
Path for the generated keytab file.
Domain to target for AD operations.
Specific domain controller to use.
Alternate credentials for AD operations.
Required acknowledgment that this operation changes the account password.
Required justification for audit logging.
Show operation plan without executing changes.
Update the account's msDS-SupportedEncryptionTypes attribute.
Restrict to AES encryption types only.
Include RC4 encryption type (not applicable for password path - AES only).
Allow obsolete encryption types (not applicable for password path - AES only).
Apply user-only ACL to output files.
Overwrite existing output files.
{{ Fill JsonSummaryPath Description }}
Generate JSON summary file.
Return operation result object.
Use fixed timestamp for deterministic output.
{{ Fill SuppressWarnings Description }}
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The account's sAMAccountName to reset password for.
Kerberos realm name. If omitted, derives from the domain.
Specific password to set. If omitted, generates a cryptographically strong random password.
Key version number to use in the keytab. If omitted, predicts the post-reset KVNO.
Salt generation policy: MIT, Heimdal, or Windows (default).
Encryption types to include. Default: AES256, AES128.
Encryption types to exclude.
Path for the generated keytab file.
Domain to target for AD operations.
Specific domain controller to use.
Alternate credentials for AD operations.
Required acknowledgment that this operation changes the account password.
Required justification for audit logging.
Show operation plan without executing changes.
Update the account's msDS-SupportedEncryptionTypes attribute.
Restrict to AES encryption types only.
Include RC4 encryption type (not applicable for password path - AES only).
Allow obsolete encryption types (not applicable for password path - AES only).
Apply user-only ACL to output files.
Overwrite existing output files.
{{ Fill JsonSummaryPath Description }}
Generate JSON summary file.
Return operation result object.
Use fixed timestamp for deterministic output.
{{ Fill SuppressWarnings Description }}
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Resets the password for svc-web and generates a corresponding keytab.
Shows what would be done without making changes.

maml:description.maml:para: Safely manage Service Principal Names (SPNs) for Active Directory accounts.

Add, remove, or list SPNs on AD accounts with built-in conflict detection, dry-run capabilities and automatic rollback on failure. Provides transactional behaviour to ensure consistent state even if operations fail partway through.
The account's sAMAccountName to modify SPNs for.
SPNs to add to the account.
SPNs to remove from the account.
List current SPNs on the account.
Show operation plan without making changes.
Domain to target for AD operations.
Specific domain controller to use.
Alternate credentials for AD operations.
Proceed even if some validations fail.
Proceed even if SPN conflicts are detected.
Path to write operation summary JSON.
Return detailed operation results.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The account's sAMAccountName to modify SPNs for.
SPNs to add to the account.
SPNs to remove from the account.
List current SPNs on the account.
Show operation plan without making changes.
Domain to target for AD operations.
Specific domain controller to use.
Alternate credentials for AD operations.
Proceed even if some validations fail.
Proceed even if SPN conflicts are detected.
Path to write operation summary JSON.
Return detailed operation results.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds HTTP SPNs to svc-web and shows the final SPN list.
Shows what would be removed without making changes.
Lists all current SPNs for svc-app.

maml:description.maml:para: Validate a keytab file and report stats.
Lightweight validation that counts entries and flags unknown encryption types.
Path to the keytab file (Pos 1).
Return a detailed object with counts and warnings instead of a boolean.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Path to the keytab file (Pos 1).
Return a detailed object with counts and warnings instead of a boolean.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.dev:code: Test-Keytab -Path .\user.keytab Returns $true when the keytab parses successfully.

maml:description.maml:para: Decrypt a DPAPI-protected keytab file.
Uses DPAPI to decrypt a previously protected keytab file. Defaults output name by stripping .dpapi suffix when present. Can restrict ACL on the output.
Path to the DPAPI-protected input file (Pos 1).
Destination for the decrypted keytab. Defaults to removing .dpapi extension (Pos 2).
DPAPI scope used for decryption: CurrentUser (default) or LocalMachine.
Additional entropy string that was used during protection (if any).
{{ Fill EntropySecure Description }}
Overwrite OutputPath if it exists.
Apply a user-only ACL to the output file.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Destination for the decrypted keytab. Defaults to removing .dpapi extension (Pos 2).

{{ Fill EntropySecure Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Unprotect-Keytab -Path .\user.keytab.dpapi -OutputPath .\user.keytab -Scope CurrentUser Decrypt a DPAPI-protected keytab into a plaintext keytab.
